intro: Mollinedia wikstroemioides, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its strap-like, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to moist, nutrient-rich soils. Mollinedia wikstroemioides plays an important ecological role in its native environment.
